result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan D Sailo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan D Sailo

defendant.name: Sailo, Alan D
defendant.address: 5095 W. Silver Lake Rd, Laona, WI 54541

records.addlTxt: 9:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alan D Sailo in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Court has waiver of right to attorney form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to counsel, finds he is competent to proceed on his own and will allow him to do so, explains the next process in the case (plead G/NG). Defendant understands charges and penalties, pleads G to only count. State willing to make an offer. Defendant wants to continue to enter G plea. State moves to amend to county ordinance of DC. Court explains that process. Court accepts amendment to DC county ordinance, pleads G, finds G. State - fine of $500.00 plus costs. Court explains that, sentences to fine of $500.00 plus costs - take bond posted - remainder due in 60 days/CO.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:20 AM Defendant Alan D Sailo in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sailo has received a copy of his complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Sailo understands. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Sailo has not and does not want one. Court advises of right to an attorney and how to obtain an attorney, private hire, SPD or court appointed if not eligible. Sailo understands. Court advises of right to waiver of counsel which would have to be held in front of the judge. Sailo would like to proceed without an attorney. State asks for bond to be $500 cash, which has been posted. Court so orders.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:15 am. Clerk provided waiver of attorney paperwork to Sailo in court.
Bonded out prior to probable cause.
